==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|か|よう|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
/kaeu/ > /kayoː/. Originally it meant the planet Mars<ref name="Amoghavajra" />. A [[calque]] of {{cog|la|dies Martis}} and its descendants, reinterpreting the day as having been named after the planet [[Mars]] (instead of the Roman god). Compare {{m|ja|火星|tr=kasei|gloss=Mars (planet)}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{IPA|/kajoː/|lang=ja}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|かよう|hhira=くわえう}}

# {{lb|ja|archaic}} planet [[Mars]]
# [[Tuesday]]

====Synonyms====
* {{l|ja|火曜日}} (kayōbi)

===See also===
* {{l|ja|七曜}} (shichiyō)
